title: Man charged after is was 'found with 70 MDMA pills at festival'
text:
A 24-year-old man will front court next month after being charged with trafficking drugs at a music festival in Adelaide.

The man was allegedly found in possession of about 70 pills, believed to be MDMA, at the Listen In Festival at Bonython Park on Sunday.

He was arrested and charged with drug trafficking after an extra 30 pills were found at his home, police say.

A 24-year-old man will front court next month after being charged with trafficking drugs at a music festival in Adelaide (pictured Listen In festival)

He has been granted bail to appear in Adelaide Magistrates Court on November 20.

About 10,000 people attended the festival where a 17-year-old boy was also arrested for an outstanding warrant when he tried to jump the fence into the venue.

Police made two other arrests, one for re-entering licensed premises and one for disorderly behaviour, but say the crowd was generally well behaved.
